help.title: Help
help.mainTitle: How to Play Link Five Dots
help.intro: Link Five Dots is a classic strategy game where two players compete on a grid to get five of their symbols in a row. The game is available in single and multiplayer modes.
rules: The game is played on a grid of dots.
Players take turns placing their symbol (a blue dot or a red cross) on an empty dot.
The winner is the first to form an unbroken line of five of their symbols horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.
If all spaces are filled without five in a row, the game is a draw.
help.singlePlayer: Single Player: Play against a bot or practice by yourself.
help.multiPlayer: Multiplayer: Create or join a room to play against another person online.
howToList: Click a dot on the board to place your symbol when it is your turn.
Use the menu buttons to navigate between game modes and settings.
tips: Try to block your opponent's progress whenever possible.
Look for opportunities to create multiple lines at once.
Forecast your moves to outsmart your opponent.
